definition: finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: He knocked the artist down for a song.
sentences.chinese: 他指名要求该艺术家唱一首歌。

sentences.english: In disagreements, fight fairly. Please No name calling.
sentences.chinese: 意见相左时，不要怒目相向，也不要指名道姓争吵。

sentences.english: Jose didn't know the answer when the teacher called on him.
sentences.chinese: 当老师指名约瑟回等时，他答不出来。

sentences.english: Any friends will be tired of the backbiting and fin-ger-pointing.
sentences.chinese: 任何朋友都讨厌背后诽谤和指名道姓的批评。

sentences.english: Specifies the named value to be deleted from the subkey.
sentences.chinese: 指定要从子项中删除的指名的值。

sentences.english: The Metropolitan Police said the threat was not specific regarding location or time.
sentences.chinese: 大都会警方说，这次威胁没指名具体地点或时间。

sentences.english: Can the poster avoid defaming a person by not using the person's name?
sentences.chinese: 发帖者在不指名道姓的情况是否可避免诽谤之嫌？

definition: roll call/to mention sb by name/(to call or praise or criticize sb) by name
to pass on a story/to communicate a message
Mao Sui recommends himself (idiom); to offer one's services (in the style of Mao Sui offering his services to king of Chu 楚 of the Warring states)
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
to plead/to claim as an excuse
to leave word/to leave a message
